OVERVIEW


While revenue assurance is not a new concept, it still is not widely accepted within the energy industry. Having started in the telecommunications industry, revenue assurance management has become the mantra of achieving operating efficiency. Now, Wall Street, private equity, and deregulation are forcing energy companies to more aggressively tackle their cost and loss issues.
 
Revenue leakage can be a significant problem for an energy company. A revenue assurance solution involves a series of activities to ensure that the business processes, controls, organizational structure and information systems related to the revenue cycle work together effectively to maximize revenues and operating margins.
 
Together, we will explore what revenue assurance programs should be initiated, when the project should be undertaken, who in the organization will sponsor them, and what technologies would be leveraged to maximize these solutions.
 
What Attendees Will Learn:
 

Revenue Assurance Basics

Common Symptoms and Causes for Revenue Leakage

Identifying Common Exposure Points

Designing Effective Revenue Controls

Designing a Revenue Assurance Organization

Billing Fraud Detection and Prevention

Developing a Revenue Assurance Dashboard and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Revenue Assurance Technology and Tools


Who Should Attend:
 
The seminar is designed for executive and management level personnel whose responsibilities may include customer service, billing, collections, internal audit, and loss prevention. In addition, information technology personnel who have overseen Customer Information System (CIS) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) projects are also strongly encouraged to attend.
